english_translation: Narrated by Jabir ibn Zayd: It reached me that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ sat one day in his gathering with a man named Mihjan, and the prayer was established. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ stood and prayed. When he finished his prayer, he looked at Mihjan while he was still in his seat. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to him: What prevented you from praying with the people? Are you not a Muslim? He said: Yes, O Messenger of Allah, but I have already prayed at home. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to him: When you come and the people are praying, pray with them even if you have already prayed at home. Al-Rabi' said: Abu Ubaidah said: The meaning of this is to make it a nafl prayer.

english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abbas: Al-Fatiha is the opening of the Book, recite it and recite in it 'In the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, the Most Compassionate' and he said it is a verse from the Book of Allah. Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: Allah the Mighty and Majestic said: I have divided the prayer between Myself and My servant into two halves, half for Me and half for My servant, and for My servant is what he asks. When the servant says 'All praise is due to Allah, Lord of the worlds', Allah says 'My servant has praised Me'. When the servant says 'The Most Merciful, the Most Compassionate', Allah says 'My servant has praised Me'. When the servant says 'Master of the Day of Judgment', Allah says 'My servant has glorified Me'. When the servant says 'You alone do we worship and from You alone do we seek help', Allah says 'This is between Me and My servant, and for My servant is what he asks'. When the servant says 'Guide us to the straight path, the path of those upon whom You have bestowed favor, not of those who have incurred Your wrath nor of those who have gone astray', Allah says 'This is for My servant, and for My servant is what he asks'.

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ came out from a prayer in which he had recited aloud and said: Did any of you recite with me just now? They said: Yes, O Messenger of Allah. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: What makes me dispute about the Qur'an? So the people stopped reciting behind the Messenger of Allah ﷺ in prayers where he recited aloud. Al-Rabi' said: Abu Ubaidah said: Except for Surah al-Fatiha, for it is recited with every imam and besides. Al-Rabi' said: From Ubadah ibn al-Samit, he said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ led us in the Fajr prayer and the recitation became heavy for him. When he finished, he said: Perhaps you are reciting behind your imam? We said: Yes. He said: Do not do so except for Surah al-Fatiha, for there is no prayer except with it.

english_translation: Narrated by Jabir ibn Zayd: I heard that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ prayed with his companions one day. When he finished the prayer, he said to his companions: Who was speaking just now saying 'Our Lord, to You is all praise, much praise, good praise, blessed praise'? A man from them said: I am, O Messenger of Allah. He said: I saw thirty-seven angels competing with each other to write it first.

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Said al-Khudri: I saw as if I was under a tree reciting Surah Sad and the Qur'an. When I reached the prostration verse, the tree prostrated and said: My Lord, grant me reward through this, remove burden from me through this, provide for me through this thanks, and accept it from me as You accepted the prostration of Your servant David. Abu Said said: I informed the Prophet ﷺ of this, and he said: We are more deserving of prostration than the tree. Then the Messenger of Allah ﷺ read it and prostrated and said this statement.

english_translation: Narrated by Jabir ibn Zayd that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Prayer of one of you while sitting is half the reward of standing prayer. And narrated from Aisha the wife of the Prophet ﷺ that she said: I never saw the Messenger of Allah ﷺ praying while sitting during voluntary night prayer. And narrated from Hafsa the wife of the Prophet ﷺ that she said: I never saw the Prophet ﷺ praying while sitting in his voluntary prayer until when it was a year before his death, I saw him praying while sitting, and he would recite the surah and perfect it (in modulation) so that it would be longer than a longer one.

english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abbas from the Prophet ﷺ that he prohibited the one praying from crouching like a dog, from pecking like a rooster, from turning around like a fox, or from sitting like a monkey. Al-Rabi' said: Crouching like a dog is spreading the forearms without raising them, and sitting like a monkey is sitting on the heels while raising the feet. Whoever does any of these four ways must repeat the prayer.
